meanings.definition: To press or squeeze something with force.
meanings.sent1: She tried to sqush the playdough into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to sqush the garlic cloves to release their flavor.
meanings.sent3: The kids squshed the grapes with their feet to make grape juice.
meanings.sent4: He squshed his opponent in the wrestling match, showing his strength.
meanings.sent5: The heavy book squshed the delicate flower beneath it.

meanings.definition: A soft, wet sound made when something is pressed or crushed.
meanings.sent1: The sqush of the mud under his boots signaled the start of the rainy season.
meanings.sent2: The sqush of the ripe tomato as she bit into it was satisfying.
meanings.sent3: The sqush of the sponge as she squeezed out the water made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: The sqush of the bug under her shoe made her cringe.
meanings.sent5: The sqush of the snow under their boots echoed in the quiet forest.

meanings.definition: A soft, wet mass of something.
meanings.sent1: She scooped up a sqush of mashed potatoes onto her plate.
meanings.sent2: The baby played happily with a sqush of colorful playdough.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a sqush of cream to the soup for extra richness.
meanings.sent4: The child's hands were covered in a sqush of paint after the art project.
meanings.sent5: The garden was full of a sqush of ripe tomatoes ready for picking.
